<root><template><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>New Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.42
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Weapons

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns true if weapon is currently rested.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[isWeaponRested]] unit

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_rest = [[isWeaponRested]] [[player]]; </code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[isWeaponDeployed]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 1, 2015 - 16:44 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRevolution]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
You can force a unit out of bipod or resting with:
<code>_unit [[playMove]] "";</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 12, 2015 - 11:00 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
As of 1.49 <code>[[isWeaponRested]] [[player]]</code> is the only current use of this command. You cannot detect remote player and you cannot detect local unit that is not a player. Might as well be a nullar command without argument.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
